intro: Senecio cymbalaria, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disc of tubular florets, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Senecio cymbalaria is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
